<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 99.1

<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#16ZBV13102_2">QuickLinks</A></FONT>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_dc13101_1_1"> </A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"Black" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"font-family:arial;" -->
</FONT></P>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="dc13101_exhibit_99.1"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_dc13101_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 99.1    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>
<IMG SRC="g1017795.jpg" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="839" HEIGHT="220">
  </B></FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="76%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=3><B>SUMMARY  </B></FONT></P>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT 
SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Generated
production of 70,031&nbsp;boe/d (77% oil and NGL) in Q2/2016;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT 
SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Delivered
funds from operations ("FFO") of $81.3&nbsp;million ($0.39 per share) 
in&nbsp;Q2/2016;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT
SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Reduced
net debt by $39&nbsp;million in Q2/2016 as funds from operations exceeded 
capital expenditures;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT 
SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Realized
an operating netback (sales price less royalties, operating and transportation 
expenses) in Q2/2016 of $14.39/boe ($18.13/boe including financial derivatives 
gain);
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT 
SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Reinitiated
production from heavy oil wells shut-in during the first quarter due to low oil 
prices; at June&nbsp;30, approximately 6,500&nbsp;boe/d of the
7,500&nbsp;boe/d previously shut-in had been re-started;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT 
SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Reduced
operating expenses by 12% to $9.42/boe in the first half of 2016, as compared to
$10.70/boe in the first half of&nbsp;2015;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT 
SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Maintained
strong levels of financial liquidity with a Senior Secured Debt to Bank EBITDA 
ratio of 0.86:1.00;&nbsp;and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT 
SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Entered
into an agreement to dispose of our operated assets in the Eagle Ford for 
approximately $55&nbsp;million. </FONT></DD></DL>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">Notes: </FONT></P>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Funds from 
operations is not a measurement based on generally accepted accounting 
principles ("GAAP") in Canada, but is a financial term commonly used in the
oil and gas industry. We define funds from operations as cash flow from 
operating activities adjusted for changes in non-cash operating working capital 
and other operating items. Baytex's funds from
operations may not be comparable to other issuers. Baytex considers funds from 
operations a key measure of performance as it demonstrates its ability to 
generate the cash flow necessary to fund
capital investments and potential future dividends. For a reconciliation of 
funds from operations to cash flow from operating activities, see Management's 
Discussion and Analysis of the operating and
financial results for the three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2016.</I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-
bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>(2)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Principal amount of instruments.  
</I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(3)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I> Net debt is a non-GAAP measure which
we define to be the sum of monetary working capital (which is current assets 
less current liabilities (excluding current financial derivatives and
assets held for sale)) and the principal amount of both the long-term notes and 
the bank&nbsp;loan.</I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-
9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(4)</I></FONT></DT><DD 
style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>Barrel of oil equivalent ("boe") amounts have been calculated 
using a
conversion rate of six thousand cubic&nbsp;feet of natural gas to one barrel of 
oil. The
use of boe amounts may be misleading, particularly if used in isolation. A boe 
conversion ratio of six thousand cubic&nbsp;feet of natural gas to one barrel of
oil is based on an energy equivalency
conversion method primarily applicable at the burner tip and does not represent 
a value equivalency at the&nbsp;wellhead.</I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-
family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>(5)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Heavy oil prices exclude condensate 
blending.
</I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT><FONT  style="font-

Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter Report</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"> 2016</FONT></P>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"Black" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"font-family:arial;" -->
</FONT> <FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><B>Advisory Regarding 
Forward-Looking Statements  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>In the interest of providing Baytex's shareholders and potential
investors with information
regarding Baytex, including management's assessment of Baytex's future plans and
operations, certain statements in this press release are "forward-looking 
statements" within the meaning of the
United&nbsp;States Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 and 
"forward-looking information" within the meaning of applicable Canadian 
securities legislation (collectively, "forward-looking
statements"). In some cases, forward-looking statements can be identified by 
terminology such as "anticipate", "believe", "continue", "could", "estimate", 
"expect", "forecast", "intend", "may",
"objective", "ongoing", "outlook", "potential", "project", "plan", "should", 
"target", "would", "will" or similar words suggesting future outcomes, events or
performance. The forward-looking
statements contained in this press release speak only as of the date thereof and
are expressly qualified by this cautionary statement.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>Specifically, this press release contains forward-looking 
statements relating to but not limited
to: our business plan, strategies and objectives, including to deploy capital 
efficiently, maintain strong levels of financial liquidity and emphasize cost 
reductions; that we are well positioned to
benefit from a continued oil price recovery and that our three core plays 
provide strong capital efficiencies; our target for 2016 capital expenditures to
approximate funds from operations in order to
minimize additional bank borrowings; our Eagle Ford shale play, including our 
assessment of the performance of wells drilled in Q2/2016, our plan to monitor 
and evaluate the multi-zone potential of
our acreage, and the cost to drill, complete and equip a well; our ability to 
partially reduce the volatility in our funds from operations by utilizing 
financial derivative contracts for commodity
prices, heavy oil differentials and interest and foreign exchange rates; the 
proportion of our anticipated oil and gas production that is hedged and the 
effectiveness of such hedges in reducing the
volatility in our funds from operations; our anticipated disposition of assets 
in Canada; that we expect funds from operations to exceed capital expenditures 
in 2016; and our expectations for
exploration and development capital expenditures and annual average production 
rate for 2016 and the impact that the spending reduction will have on our annual
average production rate for 2016. In
addition, information and statements relating to reserves are deemed to be 
forward-looking statements, as they involve implied assessment, based on certain
estimates and assumptions, that the reserves
described exist in quantities predicted or estimated, and that the reserves can 
be profitably produced in the&nbsp;future.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>These forward-looking statements are based on certain key 
assumptions regarding, among other
things: petroleum and natural gas prices and differentials between light, medium
and heavy oil prices; well production rates and reserve volumes; our ability to 
add production and reserves through our
exploration and development activities; capital expenditure levels; our ability 
to borrow under our credit agreements; the receipt, in a timely manner, of 
regulatory and other required approvals for
our operating activities; the availability and cost of labour and other industry
services; interest and foreign exchange rates; the continuance of existing and, 
in certain circumstances, proposed tax
and royalty regimes; our ability to develop our crude oil and natural gas 
properties in the manner currently contemplated; and current industry 
conditions, laws and regulations continuing in effect
(or, where changes are proposed, such changes being adopted as anticipated). 
Readers are cautioned that such assumptions, although considered reasonable by 
Baytex at the time of preparation, may prove
to be&nbsp;incorrect.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>Actual results achieved will vary from the information provided 
herein as a result of numerous
known and unknown risks and uncertainties and other factors. Such factors 
include, but are not limited to: the volatility of oil and natural gas prices; 
further declines or an extended period of the
currently low oil and natural gas prices; failure to comply with the covenants 
in our debt agreements; that our credit facilities may not provide sufficient 
liquidity or may not be renewed;
uncertainties in the capital markets that may restrict or increase our cost of 
capital or borrowing; risks associated with a third-party operating our Eagle 
Ford properties; changes in government
regulations that affect the oil and gas industry; changes in environmental, 
health and safety regulations; restrictions or costs imposed by climate change 
initiatives; variations in interest rates and
foreign exchange rates; risks associated with our hedging activities; the cost 
of developing and operating our assets; risks related to the accessibility, 
availability, proximity and capacity of
gathering, processing and pipeline systems; depletion of our reserves; risks 
associated with the exploitation of our properties and our ability to acquire 
reserves; changes in income tax or other laws
or government incentive programs; uncertainties associated with estimating 
petroleum and natural gas reserves; our inability to fully insure against all 
risks; risks of counterparty default; risks
associated with acquiring, developing and exploring for oil and natural gas and 
other aspects of our operations; risks associated with large projects; risks 
related to our thermal heavy oil projects;
risks associated with the ownership of our securities, including changes in 
market-based factors and the discretionary nature of dividend payments; risks 
for United&nbsp;States and other
non-resident shareholders, including the ability to enforce civil remedies, 
differing practices for reporting reserves and production, additional taxation 
applicable to non-residents and foreign
exchange risk; and other factors, many of which are beyond our control. These 
and additional risk factors are discussed in our Annual Information Form, Annual
Report on Form&nbsp;40-F
and&nbsp;Management's Discussion and Analysis for the year ended 
December&nbsp;31, 2015, as filed with Canadian securities regulatory authorities
and the U.S.&nbsp;Securities and Exchange
Commission.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>The above summary of assumptions and risks related to forward-
looking statements has been provided
in order to provide shareholders and potential investors with a more complete 
perspective on Baytex's current and future operations and such information may 
not be appropriate for
other&nbsp;purposes.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>There is no representation by Baytex that actual results 
achieved will be the same in whole or in
part as those referenced in the forward-looking statements and Baytex does not 
undertake any obligation to update publicly or to revise any of the included 
forward-looking statements, whether as a
result of new information, future events or otherwise, except as may be required
by applicable securities&nbsp;law.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>All amounts in this press release are stated in Canadian dollars
unless otherwise
specified.</I></FONT></P>

<A NAME="page_dd13101_1_4"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><B>Non-GAAP Financial Measures  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>Funds from operations is not a measurement based on Generally 
Accepted Accounting Principles
("GAAP") in Canada, but is a financial term commonly used in the oil and gas 
industry. Funds from operations represents cash generated from operating 
activities adjusted for changes in non-cash
operating working capital and other operating items. Baytex's determination of 
funds from operations may not be comparable with the calculation of similar 
measures for other entities. Baytex considers
funds from operations a key measure of performance as it demonstrates its 
ability to generate the cash flow necessary to fund capital investments and 
potential future dividends to shareholders. The
most directly comparable measures calculated in accordance with GAAP are cash 
flow from operating activities and net&nbsp;income.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>Net debt is not a measurement based on GAAP in Canada. We define
net debt as the sum of monetary
working capital (which is current assets less current liabilities (excluding 
current financial derivatives)) and the principal amount of both the long-term
notes and the bank loan. We believe that this measure assists in providing a 
more complete understanding of our cash liabilities.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>Bank EBITDA is not a measurement based on GAAP in Canada. We 
define Bank EBITDA as our
consolidated net income attributable to shareholders before interest, taxes, 
depletion and depreciation, and certain other non-cash items as set out in the 
credit agreement governing our revolving
credit facilities. This measure is used to measure compliance with certain 
financial covenants.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>Operating netback is not a measurement based on GAAP in Canada, 
but is a financial term commonly
used in the oil and gas industry. Operating netback is equal to product revenue 
less royalties, production and operating expenses and transportation expenses 
divided by barrels of oil equivalent sales
volume for the applicable period. Our determination of operating netback may not
be comparable with the calculation of similar measures for other entities. We 
believe that this measure assists in
characterizing our ability to generate cash margin on a unit of production 
basis.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Baytex Energy
Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter Report</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"> 2016</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_de13101_1_5"> </A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"Black" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"font-family:arial;" -->
</FONT> <FONT SIZE=3><B>MESSAGE TO SHAREHOLDERS  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Second Quarter Results  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>As we entered 2016, we laid out 
certain strategic objectives to help guide us through the commodity price 
downturn, which included deploying capital efficiently, maintaining
strong levels of financial liquidity and continuing to emphasize cost reductions
across all facets of our organization. Our second quarter results were 
reflective of these strategic objectives and we
remain well positioned to benefit from a continued recovery in crude oil prices.
We highlight below some of the results achieved to-date from the execution of 
these initiatives. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I>Capital Deployment  
</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Our emphasis on deploying capital 
efficiently was evident during the second quarter as we continued to defer 
investments in our heavy oil operations in Canada and reduced the
pace of development in the Eagle Ford. As a result, we significantly curtailed 
our level of capital spending, focusing all development activity in the Eagle 
Ford, our highest rate of return and
highest netback asset. In Q2/2016, our exploration and development expenditures 
totaled $35.5&nbsp;million, down from $81.7&nbsp;million in Q1/2016 and 
$140.8&nbsp;million in&nbsp;Q4/2015. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>During
the second quarter, we participated in the drilling of 38&nbsp;gross 
(11.3&nbsp;net) wells in the Eagle Ford and commenced production from 
20&nbsp;gross (5.7&nbsp;net) wells. This
compares to Q1/2016 when we commenced production from 34&nbsp;gross 
(10.2&nbsp;net) wells. Of the 20&nbsp;wells that commenced production during the
second
quarter, all have been producing for more than 30&nbsp;days and have established
an average 30-day initial production rate of approximately 1,300&nbsp;boe/d. We 
currently have three drilling rigs
operating on our lands, as compared to six drilling rigs in Q1/2016. We continue
to monitor and evaluate the multi-zone development potential of our acreage, 
which sees us targeting the Lower Eagle
Ford, Upper Eagle Ford and Austin Chalk formations. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>In
addition to a reduced pace of development, in Canada we shut-in approximately 
7,500&nbsp;boe/d of predominantly low or negative margin heavy oil production 
during the first quarter of 2016. As
crude oil prices recovered from the lows experienced earlier this year, we 
reinitiated production from the majority of these wells in May and June. By the 
end of June, approximately 6,500&nbsp;boe/d
of the 7,500&nbsp;boe/d previously shut-in had been re-started. We expect to 
resume production from the remaining 1,000&nbsp;boe/d in the second half
of&nbsp;2016. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Production
averaged 70,031&nbsp;boe/d (77% oil and NGL) in Q2/2016 as compared to 
75,776&nbsp;boe/d in Q1/2016, reflecting both the reduced pace of development 
and the impact of the shut-in heavy
oil&nbsp;volumes. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I>Financial Liquidity  
</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>On March&nbsp;31, 2016, we amended 
our credit facilities to provide us with increased financial flexibility. The 
amendments included reducing our credit facilities to
US$575&nbsp;million, granting our banking syndicate first priority security over
our assets and restructuring our financial covenants. The revolving facilities, 
which currently mature in
June&nbsp;2019, are not borrowing base facilities and do not require annual or 
semi-annual reviews. Our Senior Secured Debt to Bank EBITDA ratio as at 
June&nbsp;30, 2016 was 0.86:1.00 (maximum
permitted ratio of 5.00:1.00) and our interest coverage ratio was 4.05:1.00 
(minimum permitted ratio of&nbsp;1.25:1.00). </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>In
addition to amending our credit facilities, we have targeted our capital 
expenditures to approximate our funds from operations in order to minimize 
additional bank borrowings. In Q2/2016, our funds
from operations totaled $81.3&nbsp;million, as compared to capital expenditures 
of $35.5&nbsp;million, and in the first six months of 2016, our funds from 
operations totaled $126.9&nbsp;million,
as compared to capital expenditures of $117.1&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Our
net debt (bank loan, long-term notes and working capital deficiency) has 
decreased to $1.94&nbsp;billion at June&nbsp;30, 2016 from $2.05&nbsp;billion at
December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">Baytex Energy Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter 
Report</FONT> <FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">2016</FONT><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=5,EFW="2229414",CP="BAYTEX ENERGY 
CORP.",DN="2",CHK=157681,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK130:
[16ZBV1.16ZBV13101]DE13101A.;6',USER='RRICKEN',CD=';9-AUG-2016;10:57' -->
<A NAME="page_de13101_1_6"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I>Cost Reductions  </I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>We continue to have success in 
reducing our cost structure while maintaining efficiency in our operations and 
the safety of our&nbsp;employees. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Costs
in the Eagle Ford have continued to decrease with wells now being drilled, 
completed and equipped for approximately US$5.4&nbsp;million, as compared to 
US$8.2&nbsp;million in late 2014.
Despite achieving cost reductions of approximately 20% in Canada during 2015, 
the prevailing commodity prices have not supported additional drilling on our 
Canadian assets. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Operating
expenses have been reduced by 12% to $9.42/boe in the first half of 2016, as 
compared to $10.70/boe in the first half of 2015. These cost reductions reflect 
a combination of a lower overall
cost structure in Canada and our lower cost Eagle Ford assets representing a 
larger percentage of our total production. Transportation expenses are also 
down, averaging $0.90/boe through the first six
months of 2016, as compared to $1.94/boe in&nbsp;2015. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>General
and administrative expenses for the three and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 
2016 of $12.2&nbsp;million and $26.4&nbsp;million, respectively, have decreased 
from $15.6&nbsp;million and
$32.6&nbsp;million for the same periods in 2015. The decrease is attributable to
reductions in staffing levels commensurate with lower activity levels combined 
with a reduction in discretionary
spending and supplier's costs. As a continued cost control measure, all full-
time employee salaries and all annual retainers paid to our directors were 
reduced by 10% effective
March&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2016. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Operating Netback  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>During the second quarter, our 
operating netback improved by 147% as compared to Q1/2016 as crude oil prices 
strengthened from the lows of the first quarter and heavy oil
differentials tightened as a result of supply disruptions associated with the 
forest fires near Fort McMurray. In Q2/2016, the price for West Texas 
Intermediate light oil ("WTI") averaged
US$45.60/bbl, as compared to US$33.45/bbl in Q1/2016, while the discount for 
Canadian heavy oil, as measured by the price differential between Western 
Canadian Select ("WCS") and WTI, averaged
US$13.31/bbl in Q2/2016, as compared to US$14.23/bbl in&nbsp;Q1/2016. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>We
generated an operating netback in Q2/2016 of $14.39/boe ($18.13/boe including 
financial derivatives gain), up from $5.82/boe ($12.29/boe including financial 
derivatives gain) in Q1/2016. The Eagle
Ford generated an operating netback of $17.66/boe ($11.41/boe in Q1/2016) while 
our Canadian operations generated an operating netback of $10.44/boe (loss of 
$0.77/boe in&nbsp;Q1/2016). </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
following table provides a summary of our operating netbacks for the 
periods&nbsp;noted. </FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=2 VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=16 ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><BR>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Three Months Ended June&nbsp;30</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=2 style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=17 ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>6</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Baytex Energy
Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter Report</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"> 2016</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=6,EFW="2229414",CP="BAYTEX ENERGY 
CORP.",DN="2",CHK=454231,FOLIO='6',FILE='DISK130:
[16ZBV1.16ZBV13101]DE13101A.;6',USER='RRICKEN',CD=';9-AUG-2016;10:57' -->
<A NAME="page_de13101_1_7"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Risk Management  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>As part of our normal operations, we 
are exposed to movements in commodity prices, foreign exchange rates and 
interest rates. In an effort to manage these exposures, we utilize
various financial derivative contracts which are intended to partially reduce 
the volatility in our FFO. We realized a financial derivatives gain of 
$23.8&nbsp;million in Q2/2016 due to crude oil
and natural gas prices being at levels below those in our financial derivative 
contracts. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>For
the second half of 2016, we have entered into hedges on approximately 46% of our
net WTI exposure with 15% fixed at US$63.79/bbl and 31% hedged utilizing a 3-way
option structure. We have also
entered into hedges on approximately 35% of our net WCS differential exposure 
and 67% of our net natural gas&nbsp;exposure. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>For
2017, we have entered into hedges on approximately 31% of our net WTI exposure 
utilizing a 3-way option structure. We have also entered into hedges on 
approximately 23% of our net WCS differential
exposure and 44% of our net natural gas&nbsp;exposure. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>A
complete listing of our financial derivative contracts can be found in 
Note&nbsp;15 to&nbsp;our Q2/2016 financial statements. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Disposition Activity  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>In Q2/2016, we entered into an 
agreement to dispose of our operated assets in the Eagle Ford for approximately 
$55&nbsp;million. Production from these assets is currently
1,000&nbsp;boe/d and the disposition includes reserves of approximately 
1.26&nbsp;million boe on a proved plus probable basis (as&nbsp;evaluated by 
Ryder Scott Company,&nbsp;L.P. at
December&nbsp;31, 2015). This production has a lower netback than our other 
Eagle Ford barrels due to small economies of scale. The Eagle Ford transaction 
closed on July&nbsp;27, 2016. In
addition, we anticipate closing dispositions relating to an additional 
1,250&nbsp;boe/d of certain non-core assets in Canada. These transactions are 
expected to close during the
third&nbsp;quarter. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>2016 Guidance  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>As a result of continued depressed 
crude oil prices, our development activity in the Eagle Ford has been reduced. 
We currently have three drilling rigs operating on our lands,
as compared to six drilling rigs in&nbsp;Q1/2016. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Given
the reduced pace of development anticipated for the second half of 2016, we are 
now forecasting full-year 2016 exploration and development capital expenditures 
of $200 to $225&nbsp;million,
down from previous expectations of $225 to $265&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Taking
into account the above noted disposition activity and the reduced spending 
profile, we now anticipate full year 2016 production of 67,000 to 
69,000&nbsp;boe/d (previously 68,000 to
72,000&nbsp;boe/d). Excluding the impact of disposition activity, the 
approximate 13% reduction in planned spending impacts our 2016 production 
forecast by only 1%. Our 2016 program will remain
flexible and allows for adjustments to spending based on changes in the 
commodity price environment. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>At
this level of spending and based on the forward strip for crude oil and natural 
gas, we expect our funds from operations to exceed capital expenditures 
in&nbsp;2016. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Board Appointment  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The Board of Directors is pleased to 
announce the appointment of Trudy M. Curran as a director of Baytex. 
Ms.&nbsp;Curran holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in English and a
Bachelor of Laws degree (both with distinction) from the University of 
Saskatchewan and the ICD.D designation from the Institute of Corporate 
Directors. She is a retired businesswoman with extensive
experience in executive compensation, mergers and acquisitions, financing and 
governance. She served as an officer of Canadian Oil Sands Limited from 
September&nbsp;2002 to the time of its sale in
February&nbsp;2016. As Senior Vice President, General Counsel&nbsp;&amp; 
Corporate Secretary of Canadian Oil Sands Limited, she was responsible for 
legal, human resources and administration and a
member of the executive team focused on strategy and risk management. From 2003 
to 2016, she was a director of Syncrude Canada&nbsp;Ltd., where she served 
</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">Baytex Energy Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter 
Report</FONT> <FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">2016</FONT><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
SIZE=2>7</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=7,EFW="2229414",CP="BAYTEX ENERGY 
CORP.",DN="2",CHK=854720,FOLIO='7',FILE='DISK130:
[16ZBV1.16ZBV13101]DE13101A.;6',USER='RRICKEN',CD=';9-AUG-2016;10:57' -->
<A NAME="page_de13101_1_8"> </A>
<BR>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>as
chair of the Human Resources and Compensation Committee and as a member of the 
Pension Committee. She serves on the Executive Committee of the Calgary chapter 
of the Institute of Corporate
Directors and is a member of the board and the Finance and Audit Committee of 
Kids Cancer Care Foundation of&nbsp;Alberta. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Conclusion  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Our operating results for the second 
quarter were consistent with our expectations and demonstrate the commitment we 
have made during this downturn to deploy capital
efficiently, maintain strong levels of financial liquidity and reduce costs in 
all facets of our business. Importantly, our funds from operations exceeded 
capital expenditures during both the second
quarter and first half resulting in a reduction in net debt. We remain well 
positioned to benefit from a rising oil price environment with strong capital 
efficiencies across our three core
resource&nbsp;plays. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>We
look forward to executing our plans for 2016 for the ongoing benefit of all 
stakeholders and we thank you for your continued support. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>On
behalf of the Board of Directors, </FONT></P>

size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Baytex Energy
Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter Report</FONT><FONT  style="font-

<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=8,EFW="2229414",CP="BAYTEX ENERGY 
CORP.",DN="2",CHK=105233,FOLIO='8',FILE='DISK130:

<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_dg13101_1_9"> </A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"Black" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"font-family:arial;" -->
</FONT> <FONT SIZE=3><B>MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The following is management's 
discussion and analysis ("MD&amp;A") of the operating and financial results of 
Baytex Energy Corp. for the three and six months ended
June&nbsp;30, 2016. This information is provided as of July&nbsp;27, 2016. In 
this MD&amp;A, references to "Baytex", the "Company", "we", "us" and "our" and 
similar terms refer to Baytex Energy Corp.
and its subsidiaries on a consolidated basis, except where the context requires
otherwise. The results for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 
("YTD&nbsp;2016") have been compared with the
results for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 ("YTD&nbsp;2015") and the 
results for the three months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 ("Q2/2016") have been 
compared with the results for the three
months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 ("Q2/2015"). This MD&amp;A should be read in 
conjunction with the Company's condensed interim unaudited consolidated 
financial statements ("consolidated financial
statements") for the three and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, its audited 
comparative consolidated financial statements for the years ended 
December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, together with the
accompanying notes and its Annual Information Form for the year ended 
December&nbsp;31, 2015. These documents and additional information about Baytex 
are accessible on the SEDAR website at
www.sedar.com and through the U.S.&nbsp;Securities and Exchange Commission at 
www.sec.gov. All amounts are in Canadian dollars, unless otherwise stated, and 
all tabular amounts are in thousands of
Canadian dollars, except for percentages and per common share amounts or as 
otherwise noted. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>In
this MD&amp;A, barrel of oil equivalent ("boe") amounts have been calculated 
using a conversion rate of six thousand cubic&nbsp;feet of natural gas to one 
barrel of oil, which represents an energy
equivalency conversion method applicable at the burner tip and does not 
represent a value equivalency at the wellhead. While it is useful for 
comparative measures, it may not accurately reflect
individual product values and may be misleading if used in&nbsp;isolation. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>This
MD&amp;A contains forward-looking information and statements. We refer you to 
the end of the MD&amp;A for our advisory on forward-looking information 
and&nbsp;statements. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>NON-GAAP FINANCIAL MEASURES  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>In this MD&amp;A, we refer to certain
financial measures (such as funds from operations, net debt, operating netback 
and Bank EBITDA) which do not have any standardized meaning
prescribed by generally accepted accounting principles in Canada ("GAAP"). While
funds from operations, net debt and operating netback are commonly used in the 
oil and natural gas industry, our
determination of these measures may not be comparable with calculations of 
similar measures by other&nbsp;issuers. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Funds from Operations  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>We consider funds from operations 
("FFO") a key measure that provides a more complete understanding of our results
of operations and financial performance, including our
ability to generate funds for capital investments, debt repayment and potential 
dividends. However, funds from operations should not be construed as an 
alternative to performance measures determined
in accordance with GAAP, such as cash flow from operating activities and net 
income&nbsp;(loss). </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
following table reconciles cash flow from operating activities (a&nbsp;GAAP 
measure) to funds from operations (a&nbsp;non-GAAP measure). </FONT></P>

following table summarizes our net debt at June&nbsp;30, 2016 and

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Principal amount
of instruments.  </I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-
9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(2)</I></FONT></DT><DD 
style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I> 
Working capital is current assets less current liabilities (excluding current
financial derivatives and assets held for&nbsp;sale).</I></FONT></DD><DT 
style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>(3)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>In the oil and gas industry, it is not
unusual to have a working capital deficiency as accounts receivable arising from
sales of production are usually settled
within one or two months but accounts payable related to capital and operating 
expenditures are usually settled over a longer time span (often two to four 
months) due to vendor billing cycles and
internal approval processes.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Operating Netback  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>We define operating netback as oil 
and natural gas revenue, less royalties, operating expenses and transportation 
expenses. Operating netback per boe is the operating netback
divided by barrels of oil equivalent production volume for the applicable 
period. We believe that this measure assists in assessing our ability to 
generate cash margin on a unit of production basis. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Bank EBITDA  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Bank EBITDA is used to assess 
compliance with certain financial covenants. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
following table reconciles net income (loss) (a&nbsp;GAAP measure) to Bank 
EBITDA (a&nbsp;non-GAAP measure). </FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Non-cash items 
include share-based compensation, exploration and evaluation expense and gain 
(loss) on divestiture of oil and
gas&nbsp;properties.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECOND QUARTER HIGHLIGHTS  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>In Q2/2016, commodity prices improved
from Q1/2016 and our funds from operations increased 78% with higher realized 
pricing and lower operating costs. We continue to prudently
manage our capital program with funds from operations exceeding capital 
expenditures for both Q2/2016 and YTD&nbsp;2016. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>10</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Baytex Energy
Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter Report</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"> 2016</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=10,EFW="2229414",CP="BAYTEX ENERGY 
CORP.",DN="2",CHK=1000754,FOLIO='10',FILE='DISK130:
[16ZBV1.16ZBV13101]DG13101A.;11',USER='JKEENE',CD=';9-AUG-2016;12:09' -->
<A NAME="page_dg13101_1_11"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
price of West Texas Intermediate light oil ("WTI") ranged from a low of 
US$26.21/bbl in February&nbsp;2016 to a high of US$51.23/bbl in June&nbsp;2016. 
WTI averaged US$45.60/bbl in Q2/2016 up
from US$33.45/bbl in Q1/2016 but was still down from US$57.94/bbl in Q2/2015. 
With improved commodity prices, FFO increased 78% from Q1/2016 to 
$81.3&nbsp;million in Q2/2016. Our average sales price
increased 39% to $30.52/boe in Q2/2016 compared to $21.93/boe in Q1/2016. WTI 
has averaged US$39.53/bbl during 2016, a decrease of 26% as compared to the 
first six months of&nbsp;2015. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Production
averaged 70,031&nbsp;boe/d during Q2/2016, a decrease of 8% from Q1/2016. This 
decrease is a result of reduced capital spending combined with low or negative 
margin production that was
shut-in during the first half of the quarter. Canadian production averaged 
31,722&nbsp;boe/d for Q2/2016, a decrease of 9% from Q1/2016.
With improved pricing, 6,500&nbsp;boe/d of previously shut-in production was 
brought back on during the second half of Q2/2016. The Company still has 
approximately 1,000&nbsp;boe/d of production
in Canada shut-in. U.S.&nbsp;production averaged 38,309&nbsp;boe/d for Q2/2016 
which was down approximately 7% from 41,067&nbsp;boe/d in Q1/2016. This decrease
was largely anticipated due to a
reduction in the rigs and completion crews on our Eagle Ford lands during 2016 
in response to the lower commodity prices. Production averaged 72,902&nbsp;boe/d
during YTD 2016 down 17% as compared
to YTD 2015. The decrease from 2015 is mainly attributed to the limited amount 
of capital spending in Canada over the last 18&nbsp;months combined with low or 
negative margin production that was
shut in. The reduced capital spending in the Eagle Ford is also contributing to 
the decrease from the prior&nbsp;year. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Funds
from operations for Q2/2016 was $81.3&nbsp;million ($0.39 per basic and diluted
share) compared to $45.6&nbsp;million ($0.22 per basic and diluted share) in 
Q1/2016. The 78% increase in FFO
is attributable to higher commodity prices and lower operating costs in the 
quarter which was partially offset by lower hedging gains. FFO for YTD 2016 of 
$126.9&nbsp;million is down 60% from YTD
2015 and is directly attributable to lower commodity prices, lower production 
volumes in Canada and lower realized financial derivatives&nbsp;gain. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Capital
activity in the current quarter slowed from Q1/2016 with capital expenditures 
totaling $35.5&nbsp;million, a decrease of $46.2&nbsp;million from Q1/2016 and 
$71.7&nbsp;million from
Q2/2015. Despite lower activity levels in Q2/2016, 92% of total capital spending
was focused on our Eagle Ford assets. Capital spending in the Eagle Ford totaled
$32.7&nbsp;million in Q2/2016 where
we drilled 11.3&nbsp;net wells, completed 7.2&nbsp;net wells and brought 
5.7&nbsp;net wells on-stream. There was very limited activity in Canada in 
Q2/2016 with total capital spending of
$2.7&nbsp;million as compared to $7.7&nbsp;million in&nbsp;Q2/2015. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>With
reduced capital spending and higher commodity prices, our net debt decreased to 
$1.94&nbsp;billion at June&nbsp;30, 2016 from $2.05&nbsp;billion at 
December&nbsp;31, 2015. At
June&nbsp;30, 2016, we were in compliance with all of our financial covenants 
with approximately $410&nbsp;million in undrawn credit capacity. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">Baytex Energy Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter 
Report</FONT> <FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">2016</FONT><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
SIZE=2>11</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=11,EFW="2229414",CP="BAYTEX ENERGY 
CORP.",DN="2",CHK=439071,FOLIO='11',FILE='DISK130:
[16ZBV1.16ZBV13101]DG13101A.;11',USER='JKEENE',CD=';9-AUG-2016;12:09' -->
<A NAME="page_dg13101_1_12"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=3><B>RESULTS OF OPERATIONS  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The Canadian division includes the 
heavy oil assets in Peace River and Lloydminster and the conventional oil and 
natural gas assets in Western Canada. The
U.S.&nbsp;division includes the Eagle Ford assets in&nbsp;Texas. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Production  </B></FONT></P>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Production for Q2/2016 averaged 
70,031&nbsp;boe/d, a 17% decrease from Q2/2015. U.S.&nbsp;production averaged 
38,309&nbsp;boe/d in Q2/2016 which was a
slight decrease from Q2/2015 with less capital spending in Q2/2016 and fewer 
wells coming on production. Production in Canada averaged 31,722&nbsp;boe/d, a 
30% decrease from Q2/2015. Production has
decreased with natural declines as there has been minimal capital spending in 
Canada over the last 18&nbsp;months along with 7,500&nbsp;boe/d of low or 
negative margin production that was shut-in.
With increased commodity prices approximately 6,500&nbsp;boe/d of the shut-in 
production was brought back on by the end of June&nbsp;2016. The shut-in volumes
reduced average production in Q2/2016
by approximately 4,250&nbsp;boe/d. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>12</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Baytex Energy
Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter Report</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"> 2016</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=12,EFW="2229414",CP="BAYTEX ENERGY 
CORP.",DN="2",CHK=680692,FOLIO='12',FILE='DISK130:
[16ZBV1.16ZBV13101]DG13101A.;11',USER='JKEENE',CD=';9-AUG-2016;12:09' -->
<A NAME="page_dg13101_1_13"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Production
for YTD 2016 averaged 72,902&nbsp;boe/d, a 17% decrease from YTD 2015. 
U.S.&nbsp;production averaged 39,688&nbsp;boe/d in YTD 2016 and was relatively 
unchanged from YTD 2015 with
continued capital investment in the Eagle Ford offsetting the production
declines. Canadian production of 33,214&nbsp;boe/d decreased 30%, or 
14,186&nbsp;boe/d, from YTD 2015 due to minimal
capital investment along with low or negative margin production that was shut-
in. The shut-in volumes reduced average production in YTD 2016 by approximately 
4,600&nbsp;boe/d. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Commodity Prices  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The prices received for our crude oil
and natural gas production directly impact our earnings, funds from operations 
and our financial position. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I>Crude Oil  </I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>For Q2/2016, the WTI oil prompt 
averaged US$45.60/bbl, a 21% decrease from the average WTI price of US$57.94/bbl
in Q2/2015. For YTD 2016, the WTI oil prompt averaged
US$39.53/bbl, a 26% decrease from the
average WTI price of US$53.29/bbl for YTD 2015. The low prices experienced 
during 2016, as compared to 2015, were due to the continued global oversupply of
crude oil and on-going concerns due to the
high levels of inventory in&nbsp;storage. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
discount for Canadian heavy oil is measured by the Western Canadian Select 
("WCS") price differential to WTI. For the three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30, 2016, the WCS heavy oil
differential averaged US$13.31/bbl and US$13.77/bbl, respectively, compared to 
US$11.59/bbl and US$13.15/bbl for the same periods in 2015. Over the past year, 
increased pipeline capacity from Canada
to the U.S.&nbsp;Gulf Coast has allowed WCS pricing to achieve pipeline 
equivalency with the large waterborne Gulf Coast refinery market. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I>Natural Gas  </I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>For the three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30, 2016, the AECO natural gas prices averaged $1.25/mcf and 
$1.68/mcf, respectively, a decrease compared to $2.67/mcf and
$2.81/mcf for the same periods in 2015. For the three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30, 2016, the NYMEX natural gas price averaged US$1.95/mmbtu and 
US$2.02/mmbtu, respectively, a decrease compared
to US$2.64/mmbtu and US$2.81/mmbtu for the same periods in 2015. The decrease in
natural gas prices on both indices during 2016 was driven by historically high 
production levels and extremely weak
weather related demand compared to&nbsp;2015. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
following table compares selected benchmark prices and our average realized 
selling prices for the three and six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2016. 
</FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=2 style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=11 ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><HR NOSHADE></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=2 style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="10%" ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR> </B></FONT><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><B>2016</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">2015</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">Change</FONT></TD>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>WTI refers to 
the arithmetic average of NYMEX prompt month WTI for the applicable 
period.</I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(2)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>WCS refers to 
the average
posting price for the benchmark WCS heavy oil.  </I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-
family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>(3)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I> LLS refers to the Argus trade month 
average for Louisiana Light Sweet oil.  </I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-
family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>(4)
</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I> AECO refers to the AECO arithmetic average month-ahead index 
price published by the Canadian Gas Price Reporter ("CGPR").</I></FONT></DD><DT 
style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>(5)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>NYMEX refers to
the NYMEX last day average index price as published by 
the&nbsp;CGPR.</I></FONT><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">
 </FONT></DD></DL>

<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>$</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>43.71</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>$</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>38.30</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=19 style="font-family:arial;"><HR NOSHADE SIZE=4></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Baytex's risk 
management strategy employs both oil and natural gas financial and physical 
forward contracts (fixed price forward sales and collars) and heavy
oil differential physical delivery contracts (fixed price and percentage of 
WTI). The pricing information in the table excludes the impact of financial 
derivatives.</I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-
9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(2)</I></FONT></DT><DD 
style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>Realized
heavy oil prices are calculated based on sales volumes, net of 
blending&nbsp;costs.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I>Average Realized Sales Prices  
</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>U.S.&nbsp;light oil and condensate 
pricing for Q2/2016 was $52.79/bbl, down 19% from $65.34/bbl in Q2/2015, which 
is slightly less than the 22% decrease in the LLS benchmark
(expressed in Canadian dollars). U.S.&nbsp;light oil and condensate pricing for 
YTD 2016 was $45.03/bbl, down 23% from $58.81/bbl in YTD 2015 also slightly less
than the 24% decrease in the LLS
benchmark (expressed in Canadian dollars). Reduced supply along with increased 
pipeline capacity have tightened the pricing differential between our 
U.S.&nbsp;light oil and condensate to LLS
during&nbsp;2016. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>During
Q2/2016, our Canadian average sales price for light oil and condensate was 
$47.24/bbl, down 24% from $62.20/bbl in Q2/2015, as compared to a 19% decrease 
in the benchmark Edmonton par price.
Canadian light oil and condensate pricing was $41.37/bbl for YTD 2016 compared 
to $54.72/bbl for YTD 2015, a 24% decrease compared to a 20% decrease in the
benchmark Edmonton par price. Our Canadian
realized price decreased slightly more than the benchmark when comparing 2016 to
2015 as a higher percentage of our Canadian light oil production in 2016 is 
comprised of medium grade crude which has a
higher discount to the benchmark price. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Our
realized heavy oil price for Q2/2016 was $30.09/bbl, a $14.50/bbl decrease from 
Q2/2015. YTD 2016, our realized heavy oil price was $20.87/bbl, a $15.34/bbl 
decrease from YTD 2015. The decrease in
our realized heavy oil price during 2016 generally coincides with the decrease 
in the WCS benchmark price (expressed in Canadian dollars) which decreased from 
2015 by $15.37/bbl for Q2/2016 and by
$15.28/bbl for YTD 2016 as our heavy oil is generally sold at a fixed dollar 
differential to the benchmark. Our price decreased slightly less than the 
benchmark during 2016 as the volumes shut-in have
a higher discount to the benchmark price resulting in better price realizations 
in&nbsp;2016. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Our
Canadian average realized natural gas price for the three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30, 2016 was $1.30/mcf and $1.62/mcf, respectively, down 50% and 38% 
from the same periods in 2015. The
decrease in our realized price was consistent with the decrease in the AECO 
benchmarks for the three and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 of 53% and 40% 
from the same periods in&nbsp;2015. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Our
U.S.&nbsp;average realized natural gas price for the three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30, 2016 was $2.39/mcf and $2.57/mcf, respectively, down 30% and 28% 
from the same periods of 2015.
The decrease in the U.S.&nbsp;average </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>14</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Baytex Energy
Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter Report</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"> 2016</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=14,EFW="2229414",CP="BAYTEX ENERGY 
CORP.",DN="2",CHK=793035,FOLIO='14',FILE='DISK130:
[16ZBV1.16ZBV13101]DG13101A.;11',USER='JKEENE',CD=';9-AUG-2016;12:09' -->
<A NAME="page_dg13101_1_15"> </A>
<BR>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>realized
natural gas price was consistent with the decrease in the NYMEX benchmark for 
the three and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 of 26% and 28% for the same 
periods of&nbsp;2015. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Our
realized NGL price was $13.28/bbl or 23% of WTI (expressed in Canadian dollars) 
in Q2/2016 compared to $15.78/bbl or 22% of WTI (expressed in Canadian dollars) 
in Q2/2015. For YTD 2016, our
realized NGL price was 30% of WTI (expressed in Canadian dollars) which is 
slightly higher than 27% of WTI in YTD 2015. In Q2/2016, the operator of our 
Eagle Ford assets reversed the changes to
certain post-production NGL processing arrangements that were recorded in 
Q1/2016 which reduced NGL revenues and operating expenses in Q2/2016 but have no
impact on YTD&nbsp;2016. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Gross Revenues  </B></FONT></P>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Total petroleum and natural gas 
revenues for Q2/2016 of $195.7&nbsp;million decreased $147.1&nbsp;million from 
Q2/2015 with lower commodity prices
contributing $82.1&nbsp;million of the decrease and the remaining 
$65.0&nbsp;million from lower production volumes. Petroleum and natural gas 
revenues of $120.0&nbsp;million in the
U.S.&nbsp;decreased $47.9&nbsp;million from Q2/2015 due to a decrease in 
realized prices on all&nbsp;products. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>In
Canada, petroleum and natural gas revenues for Q2/2016 totaled 
$75.7&nbsp;million, a $99.2&nbsp;million decrease compared to Q2/2015 due to 
lower realized prices and lower production volumes. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">Baytex Energy Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter 
Report</FONT> <FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">2016</FONT><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
SIZE=2>15</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=15,EFW="2229414",CP="BAYTEX ENERGY 
CORP.",DN="2",CHK=51631,FOLIO='15',FILE='DISK130:
[16ZBV1.16ZBV13101]DG13101A.;11',USER='JKEENE',CD=';9-AUG-2016;12:09' -->
<A NAME="page_dg13101_1_16"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Total
petroleum and natural gas revenues for YTD 2016 of $349.3&nbsp;million decreased
$276.9&nbsp;million from YTD 2015 with lower commodity prices contributing 
$163.3&nbsp;million of the
decrease and the remaining $113.6&nbsp;million from lower production volumes. 
Petroleum and natural gas revenues of $228.5&nbsp;million in the 
U.S.&nbsp;decreased $90.4&nbsp;million from YTD
2015 mainly due to a decrease in realized prices on all products. In Canada, 
petroleum and natural gas revenues for YTD 2016 totaled $120.8&nbsp;million, a 
$186.4&nbsp;million decrease compared to
YTD 2015 due to lower realized prices and lower production volumes. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Heavy
oil blending revenue of $1.2&nbsp;million and $3.6&nbsp;million for the three 
and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, respectively, decreased 
$7.3&nbsp;million and $14.6&nbsp;million
compared to the same periods in 2015. Heavy oil blending revenue decreased in 
2016 as the Company sold less diluent with the decrease in heavy oil production 
in Canada. Heavy oil transported through
pipelines requires blending to reduce its viscosity in order to meet pipeline 
specifications. The cost of blending diluent is recovered in the sale price of 
the blended product. Our heavy oil
transported by rail does not require blending diluent. The purchases and sales 
of blending diluent are recorded as heavy oil blending expense and revenue, 
respectively. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Royalties  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Royalties are paid to various 
government entities and to land and mineral rights owners. Royalties are 
calculated based on gross revenues, or on operating netbacks less capital
investment for specific heavy oil projects, and are generally expressed as a 
percentage of gross revenue. The actual royalty rates can vary for a number of 
reasons, including the commodity produced,
royalty contract terms, commodity price level, royalty incentives and the area 
or jurisdiction. The following table summarizes our royalties and royalty rates 
for the three and six months ended
June&nbsp;30, 2016 and&nbsp;2015. </FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<TD WIDTH="22%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Royalty rate per 
boe</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>$</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>1.94</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>$</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>9.03</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>$</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>5.80</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>$</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="10%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>4.86</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD WIDTH="8%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>12.74</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Average royalty 
rate excludes sales of heavy oil blending diluents and the effects of financial 
derivatives.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Total royalties for Q2/2016 of 
$42.4&nbsp;million decreased 46%, or $35.5&nbsp;million, from Q2/2015, due to 
the decline in gross revenues. The overall
royalty rate in Q2/2016 of 21.8% was slightly lower than 23.3% in Q2/2015. The 
royalty rate decreased slightly as the royalty rate in Canada was lower in 
Q2/2016 as a result of lower prices. Canadian
royalties decreased to 10.6% of revenue for Q2/2016, compared to 17.0% of 
revenue in Q2/2015. Canadian crown royalty rates are partially based on price 
and with the lower commodity prices experienced
during Q2/2016, the Company recorded lower crown royalty rates compared to 
Q2/2015. The royalty percentage on our U.S.&nbsp;assets does not vary with price
and as a result the U.S.&nbsp;royalty
rate in Q2/2016 of 28.7% has remained fairly consistent with the Q2/2015 rate of
29.5% and overall royalties have decreased with the decrease in 
gross&nbsp;revenues. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Total
royalties for YTD 2016 of $77.0&nbsp;million decreased 43%, or 
$57.6&nbsp;million, from YTD 2015, due to the decline in gross revenues. The 
overall royalty rate in YTD 2016 of 22.3% was
consistent with 22.1% in YTD 2015. The Canadian royalty rate decreased, but a 
higher proportion of our revenue came from the U.S.&nbsp;in YTD 2016 which has 
higher royalty rates offsetting the
impact of the decrease in the Canadian rate on the overall royalty rate. 
Canadian royalties decreased to 10.0% of revenue for YTD 2016, compared to 14.4%
of revenue in YTD 2015 due to lower commodity
prices. The royalty percentage on our U.S.&nbsp;assets does not vary with price 
and as a result the YTD 2016 U.S.&nbsp;royalty rate of 28.5% has remained 
consistent with the YTD 2015 rate of 29.1%
and overall royalties have decreased with the decrease in gross&nbsp;revenues. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>16</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Baytex Energy
Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter Report</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"> 2016</FONT></P>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Operating 
expenses related to the Eagle Ford assets include transportation 
expenses.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Operating expenses of 
$55.3&nbsp;million and $125.0&nbsp;million for the three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30, 2016, respectively, decreased by
$26.8&nbsp;million and $44.9&nbsp;million compared to the same periods in 2015. 
Overall operating costs are down as production has decreased in 2016 compared to
2015. Operating expenses are also
down on a unit of production basis with operating costs decreasing to $8.67/boe 
and $9.42/boe for the three and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 
respectively, compared to $10.64/boe and
$10.70/boe for the same periods in 2015. The lower cost Eagle Ford assets 
comprise a larger proportion of our overall volumes which is helping to reduce 
our overall operating costs per boe. In Canada,
we are also seeing the impacts of our cost savings initiatives along with the 
benefit of shutting-in higher cost properties as our operating expenses per unit
of production were lower in the three and
six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 compared to same periods in&nbsp;2015. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>U.S.&nbsp;operating
expenses of $24.0&nbsp;million for Q2/2016 decreased $2.7&nbsp;million compared 
to Q2/2015. In Q1/2016, the operator of the Eagle Ford property changed certain
post-production processing arrangements which increased operating expenses and 
revenues. In Q2/2016, this change was reversed by the operator resulting in a 
decrease to operating expenses and
revenues. The reversal of the post production processing arrangement reduced 
operating costs by approximately $1.00/boe in Q2/2016 with no impact on the YTD 
2016. On a unit of production basis, YTD
2016 operating expenses were $8.17/boe compared to $7.39/boe in YTD 2015 
representing an increase of $0.78/boe. This increase in per unit costs in the 
U.S is primarily a result of the weaker Canadian
dollar against the U.S.&nbsp;dollar. Operating expenses per boe in 
U.S.&nbsp;dollars for YTD 2016 have averaged US$6.17/boe which is comparable to 
YTD 2015 costs of&nbsp;US$5.98/boe. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Canadian
operating expenses of $31.3&nbsp;million and $65.9&nbsp;million for the three 
and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, respectively, decreased 
$24.1&nbsp;million and
$50.0&nbsp;million compared to the same periods in 2015. The decrease is a 
result of lower production volumes and realized cost savings across all of our 
operations. On a per boe basis, Canadian
operating expenses were $10.84/boe and $10.91/boe for the three and six months 
ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, respectively, compared to $13.45/boe and $13.51/boe 
for the same periods in 2015 reflecting
the cost savings initiatives during 2016 and the impact of high cost production 
being shut-in for part of YTD 2016. As commodity prices improve and the higher 
cost shut-in volumes are restored, we
expect Canadian operating expenses, on a unit of production basis, 
to&nbsp;increase. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">Baytex Energy Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter 
Report</FONT> <FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">2016</FONT><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
SIZE=2>17</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

<A NAME="page_dh13101_1_18"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Transportation Expenses  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Transportation expenses include the 
costs to move production from the field to the sales point. The largest 
component of transportation expenses relates to the trucking of
heavy oil to pipeline and rail terminals. The following table compares our 
transportation expenses for the three and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 
and&nbsp;2015. </FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Transportation 
expenses related to the Eagle Ford assets have been included in operating 
expenses.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Transportation expenses for the three
and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 totaled $5.1&nbsp;million and 
$11.9&nbsp;million, respectively, a decrease
of 66% and 61% from the same periods in 2015. The decrease is due to lower heavy
oil volumes being transported to the sales point, decreased fuel costs and the 
increased use of lower cost internal
trucking. On a per unit basis, costs have decreased as a large portion of the 
shut-in volumes were subject to higher transportation charges. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Blending Expenses  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Blending expenses for the three and 
six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 of $1.2&nbsp;million and $3.6&nbsp;million, 
respectively, have decreased compared to
$8.5&nbsp;million and $18.1&nbsp;million for the same periods of 2015. 
Consistent with the decrease in heavy oil blending revenue, blending expenses 
decreased due to a decrease in both the volume
of blending diluent required and the price of blending diluent. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Financial Derivatives  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>As part of our normal operations, we 
are exposed to movements in commodity prices, foreign exchange rates and 
interest rates. In an effort to manage these exposures, we utilize
various financial derivative contracts which are intended to partially reduce 
the volatility in our funds from operations. Financial derivatives are managed 
at the corporate level and are not
allocated between divisions. Contracts settled in the period result in realized 
gains or losses based on the market price compared to the contract price. 
Changes in the fair value of contracts are
reported as unrealized gains or losses in the period as the forward markets for 
commodities and currencies fluctuate and as </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>18</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Baytex Energy
Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter Report</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"> 2016</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=18,EFW="2229414",CP="BAYTEX ENERGY 
CORP.",DN="2",CHK=533470,FOLIO='18',FILE='DISK130:
[16ZBV1.16ZBV13101]DH13101A.;20',USER='JKEENE',CD=';9-AUG-2016;13:10' -->
<A NAME="page_dh13101_1_19"> </A>
<BR>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>new
contracts are executed. The following table summarizes the results of our 
financial derivative contracts for the three and six months ended June&nbsp;30,
2016 and&nbsp;2015. </FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=2 VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=7 ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><BR>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Three Months Ended June&nbsp;30</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=7 ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><BR>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Six Months Ended June&nbsp;30</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Unrealized 
interest and financing derivatives gain (loss) includes the change in fair value
of the call options embedded in our long-term
notes.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The realized financial derivatives 
gain of $23.8&nbsp;million and $68.4&nbsp;million for three and six months ended
June&nbsp;30, 2016, respectively,
relate mainly to crude oil prices being at levels below those set in our fixed 
price contracts. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
unrealized financial derivatives loss of $80.6&nbsp;million for Q2/2016 is due 
to the increase in WTI price at June&nbsp;30, 2016 as compared to March&nbsp;31,
2016 and the realization, or
reversal, of previous unrealized gains recorded at March&nbsp;31, 2016. The 
unrealized financial derivatives loss of $110.7&nbsp;million for YTD 2016 is due
to the increase in WTI price at
June&nbsp;30, 2016 as compared to December&nbsp;31, 2015 and the realization, or
reversal, of previous unrealized gains recorded at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>A
summary of the financial derivative contracts in place as at June&nbsp;30, 2016 
and the accounting treatment thereof are disclosed in note&nbsp;15 to&nbsp;the 
consolidated financial
statements. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">Baytex Energy Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter 
Report</FONT> <FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">2016</FONT><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
SIZE=2>19</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exploration and Evaluation Expense
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Exploration and evaluation expense 
includes the derecognition of exploration and evaluation assets and will vary 
from period to period depending on the expiry of leases and
assessment of our exploration programs and&nbsp;assets. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Exploration
and evaluation expense decreased to $1.9&nbsp;million for Q2/2016 from 
$2.2&nbsp;million in Q2/2015. Exploration and evaluation expense decreased to 
$3.4&nbsp;million for YTD 2016
from $4.5&nbsp;million for YTD 2015. The decrease is due to lower expiries of 
undeveloped&nbsp;land. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>20</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Baytex Energy
Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter Report</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"> 2016</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Total includes 
corporate depreciation.  </I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Depletion and depreciation expense of
$121.9&nbsp;million and $263.6&nbsp;million for the three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30, 2016, respectively,
decreased by $39.5&nbsp;million and $72.0&nbsp;million from the same periods in 
2015. On a per boe basis, depletion and depreciation expense for the three and 
six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016
of $19.13/boe and $19.87/boe, respectively, decreased from $20.93/boe and 
$21.14/boe for the same periods in 2015. The depletion rate decreased during 
2016 as we recorded $755.6&nbsp;million of
impairments on U.S.&nbsp;oil and gas properties in 2015 which reduced the 
depletable base and the depletion rate for&nbsp;2016. </FONT></P>
