<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>General and administrative expenses 
for the three and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 of $12.2&nbsp;million and 
$26.4&nbsp;million, respectively,
decreased from $15.6&nbsp;million and $32.6&nbsp;million for the same periods in
2015. The decreases are attributable to reductions in staffing levels 
commensurate with lower activity levels
combined with a reduction in discretionary spending. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Share-Based Compensation Expense  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Compensation expense associated with 
the Share Award Incentive Plan is recognized in net income (loss) over the 
vesting period of the share awards with a corresponding increase
in contributed surplus. The issuance of common shares upon the conversion of 
share awards is recorded as an increase in shareholders' capital with a 
corresponding reduction in contributed surplus. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Compensation
expense related to the Share Award Incentive Plan was $3.9&nbsp;million and 
$8.4&nbsp;million for the three and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 
respectively, compared to
$8.2&nbsp;million and $16.2&nbsp;million for the same periods in 2015. The 
decrease in share-based compensation expense for both periods is a result of a 
lower fair value of share awards granted
due to a reduction in the Company's share price at grant date for new grants 
in&nbsp;2016. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">Baytex Energy Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter 
Report</FONT> <FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">2016</FONT><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
SIZE=2>21</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=21,EFW="2229414",CP="BAYTEX ENERGY 
CORP.",DN="2",CHK=800620,FOLIO='21',FILE='DISK130:
[16ZBV1.16ZBV13101]DH13101A.;20',USER='JKEENE',CD=';9-AUG-2016;13:10' -->
<A NAME="page_dh13101_1_22"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Financing and Interest Expenses  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Financing and interest expenses 
include interest on bank loan and long-term notes, non-cash financing costs and 
accretion on asset retirement obligations. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Financing
and interest expenses increased $1.1&nbsp;million to $27.9&nbsp;million for 
Q2/2016, compared to $26.8&nbsp;million in Q2/2015. The Canadian dollar was 
weaker in Q2/2016 compared to
Q2/2015 which increased our interest expense on our long-term notes as the 
majority of our long-term notes are denominated in U.S.&nbsp;dollars. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Financing
and interest expenses increased slightly to $56.9&nbsp;million for YTD 2016, 
compared to $56.2&nbsp;million in YTD 2015. Interest on long-term notes 
increased to $45.3&nbsp;million
during YTD 2016 compared to $43.4&nbsp;million in YTD 2015 as the Canadian 
dollar was weaker against the U.S.&nbsp;dollar in YTD 2016 compared to YTD 2015 
which increased our interest expense as a
majority of our long-term notes are denominated in U.S.&nbsp;dollars. This was 
offset by lower interest charges on our bank loan in 2016 as compared to 2015 as
we had larger bank loans in 2015
before the proceeds from the equity financing on April&nbsp;2, 2015, were used 
to reduce bank indebtedness. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Foreign Exchange  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Unrealized foreign exchange gains and
losses are recognized with the change in the value of the long-term notes and 
bank loan denominated in U.S.&nbsp;dollars. The long-term
notes and bank loan are translated to Canadian dollars on the balance sheet date
and a strengthening Canadian dollar against the U.S.&nbsp;dollar from current 
period to previous period will result
in unrealized gains and a weakening Canadian dollar will result in unrealized 
losses. Realized foreign exchange gains and losses are due to day-to-day 
U.S.&nbsp;dollar denominated transactions
occurring in the Canadian operations. </FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Three Months Ended June&nbsp;30</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT

<TD WIDTH="23%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-

<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-

<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The Company recorded unrealized 
foreign exchange loss of $3.5&nbsp;million for Q2/2016 as the Canadian dollar 
weakened against the U.S.&nbsp;dollar at
June&nbsp;30, 2016 as compared to March&nbsp;31, 2016. The Company recorded 
unrealized foreign exchange gain of $83.3&nbsp;million for YTD 2016 as the 
Canadian dollar strengthened against the
U.S.&nbsp;dollar at June&nbsp;30, 2016 as compared to 
December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company realizes foreign exchange gains and losses from day-to-day 
U.S.&nbsp;dollar denominated transactions in its Canadian entities. For the 
three and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016,
the Company recorded realized foreign exchange gains of $0.2&nbsp;million and 
$0.8&nbsp;million, respectively. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>22</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Baytex Energy
Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter Report</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"> 2016</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>

<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>)</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>$</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>(61,018</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>)</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=19 style="font-family:arial;"><HR NOSHADE SIZE=4></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>In 2016, available tax deductions 
exceeded taxable income which allowed the Company to recover a portion of the 
prior year current income tax expense. For
Q2/2016, this resulted in a current income tax recovery of $2.3&nbsp;million, an
increase of $1.7&nbsp;million over the current income tax recovery of 
$0.6&nbsp;million in Q2/2015. For YTD 2016,
this resulted in a current income tax recovery of $3.7&nbsp;million, an increase
of $20.1&nbsp;million over the current income tax expense of $16.4&nbsp;million 
in YTD&nbsp;2015. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
deferred income tax recovery of $46.8&nbsp;million for Q2/2016 increased 
$34.5&nbsp;million from $12.3&nbsp;million for Q2/2015. The deferred income tax 
recovery of $94.9&nbsp;million for
YTD 2016 increased $40.9&nbsp;million from $54.0&nbsp;million for YTD 2015. The 
increase for both periods is primarily the result of a decrease in the amount of
tax pool claims required to shelter
the lower taxable&nbsp;income. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>In
June&nbsp;2016, certain indirect subsidiary entities received reassessments from
the Canada Revenue Agency (the&nbsp;"CRA") that deny non-capital loss deductions
relevant to the calculation of
income taxes for the years 2011 through 2015. These reassessments follow the 
previously disclosed letter which we received in November&nbsp;2014 from the 
CRA, proposing to issue such reassessments. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>We
remain confident that the tax filings of the affected entities are correct and 
will vigorously defend our tax filing positions. The reassessments do not 
require us to pay any amounts in order to
participate in the appeals process. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>We
will file&nbsp;a notice of objection for each notice of reassessment received. 
These notices of objection will be reviewed by the Appeals Division of the CRA;
a process that we estimate could
take up to two years. If the Appeals Division upholds the notices of 
reassessment, we have the right to appeal to the Tax Court of Canada; a process 
that we estimate could take a further two years.
Should we be unsuccessful at the Tax Court of Canada, additional appeals are 
available; a process that we estimate could take another two years and 
potentially longer. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>By
way of background, we acquired several privately held commercial trusts in 2010 
with accumulated non-capital losses of $591&nbsp;million (the&nbsp;"Losses"). 
The Losses were subsequently used
to reduce the taxable income of those trusts. The reassessments disallow the 
deduction of the Losses under the general anti-avoidance rule of the Income 
Tax&nbsp;Act (Canada). If, after exhausting
available appeals, the deduction of Losses continues to be disallowed, we will 
owe cash taxes for the years 2012 through 2015 and an additional amount for late
payment interest. The amount of cash
taxes owing and the late payment interest are dependent upon the amount of 
unused tax shelter available to offset the reassessed income, including tax 
shelter from future years available for "carry
back" to the years 2012 through&nbsp;2015. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Net Income (Loss) and Funds from 
Operations  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Net loss for Q2/2016 totaled 
$86.9&nbsp;million ($0.41 per basic and diluted share) compared to net loss of 
$27.0&nbsp;million ($0.13 per basic and diluted share) for
Q2/2015. Net loss for YTD 2016 totaled $86.3&nbsp;million ($0.41 per basic and 
diluted share) compared to net loss of $202.9&nbsp;million ($1.08 per basic and 
diluted share) for YTD 2015. Funds
from operations for Q2/2016 totaled $81.3&nbsp;million ($0.39 per basic and 
diluted share) as compared to $158.1&nbsp;million ($0.60 per basic and diluted 
share) for Q2/2015. Funds from operations
for YTD 2016 totaled $126.9&nbsp;million ($0.60 per basic and diluted share) as 
compared to $318.3&nbsp;million ($1.70 per basic and diluted share) for YTD 
2015. The </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">Baytex Energy Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter 
Report</FONT> <FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">2016</FONT><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
SIZE=2>23</FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>For net income 
(loss), other includes gain (loss) on disposition and 
other&nbsp;expense.</I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-
9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(2)</I></FONT></DT><DD 
style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>For 
funds from operations,
other includes other expense.  </I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Dividends  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>In 2015, we declared monthly 
dividends of $0.10 per common share for January to June totaling $0.60 per 
common share. The Company paid $83.2&nbsp;million in cash dividends in
YTD 2015, and $25.5&nbsp;million of dividends declared were settled by issuing 
1,262,000&nbsp;common shares under the Company's dividend reinvestment plan. In 
response to the prolonged low price
commodity environment and in an effort to preserve liquidity, Baytex suspended 
the monthly dividend effective September&nbsp;2015. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Other Comprehensive Income (Loss) 
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Other comprehensive income (loss) is 
comprised of the foreign currency translation adjustment on U.S.&nbsp;net assets
not recognized in profit or loss. The
$6.1&nbsp;million foreign currency translation gain for Q2/2016 is due to a 
slight weakening of the Canadian dollar against the U.S.&nbsp;dollar at 
June&nbsp;30, 2016 as compared to
March&nbsp;31, 2016. The $152.6&nbsp;million foreign currency translation loss 
for YTD 2016 is due to the strengthening of the Canadian dollar against the 
U.S.&nbsp;dollar at June&nbsp;30,
2016 as compared to December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>24</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Baytex Energy
Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter Report</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"> 2016</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>YTD 2016 capital expenditures totaled
$117.1&nbsp;million as compared to $256.2&nbsp;million in YTD 2015. Capital 
spending has been focused on our Eagle
Ford assets with YTD 2016 capital spending of $109.6&nbsp;million down from 
$224.4&nbsp;million for YTD 2015. The decrease in spending is from lower 
activity levels with lower commodity prices and
from significant cost savings achieved on our Eagle Ford program. Total costs in
the Eagle Ford have continued to decrease with wells now being drilled, 
completed and equipped for approximately
US$5.4&nbsp;million as compared to US$8.2&nbsp;million in 2014. We also 
recognized additional savings on drilling, completion and equipping expenditures
in Q2/2016 as actual costs incurred were
less than previously estimated. In Canada, we have drilled one well in YTD 2016 
and have spent $7.6&nbsp;million compared to YTD 2015 where we drilled 
11.1&nbsp;net wells and spent
$29.0&nbsp;million. Despite achieving cost reductions of approximately 20% in 
Canada during 2015, the prevailing commodity prices have not supported 
additional drilling on our Canadian assets. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>In
Q2/2016, our capital expenditures totaled $35.5&nbsp;million compared to 
$107.2&nbsp;million in Q2/2015 and were focused on our Eagle Ford assets with 
92% of the total capital being spent in
the U.S.&nbsp;The significant reduction year over year is due to reduced 
activity levels in Canada and the Eagle Ford and from cost savings on the Eagle 
Ford program that were recognized in Q2/2016
as actual costs incurred were less than previously estimated. We did not drill 
any wells in Canada and spent $2.7&nbsp;million in Q2/2016 as compared to
2.0&nbsp;net wells and $7.7&nbsp;million
in&nbsp;Q2/2015. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Subsequent
to the end of the quarter, we closed the sale of our operated assets in the 
Eagle Ford on July&nbsp;27, 2016 for approximately $55&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">Baytex Energy Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter 
Report</FONT> <FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">2016</FONT><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
SIZE=2>25</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=25,EFW="2229414",CP="BAYTEX ENERGY 
CORP.",DN="2",CHK=341732,FOLIO='25',FILE='DISK130:

<A NAME="page_di13101_1_26"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>LIQUIDITY, CAPITAL RESOURCES AND 
RISK MANAGEMENT  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>We regularly review our capital 
structure and liquidity sources to ensure that our capital resources will be 
sufficient to meet our on-going short, medium and long-term
commitments. Specifically, we believe that our internally generated funds from 
operations and our existing undrawn credit facilities will provide sufficient 
liquidity to sustain our operations and
planned capital expenditures. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>We
regularly review our exposure to counterparties to ensure they have the 
financial capacity to honor outstanding obligations to us in the normal course 
of business. We periodically review the
financial capacity of our counterparties and, in certain circumstances, we will 
seek enhanced credit protection. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
current commodity price environment has reduced our internally generated funds 
from operations. As a result, we have taken several steps to protect our 
liquidity, which included reducing our 2016
capital program by approximately 33% from our initial plans and working with our
lending syndicate to secure our bank credit facilities. We also shut-in low or 
negative margin production for part
of&nbsp;2016. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>If
the current commodity price environment continues, or if prices decline further,
we may need to make additional changes to our capital program. A sustained low 
price environment could lead to a
default of certain financial covenants, which could impact our ability to borrow
under existing credit facilities or obtain new financing. It could also restrict
our ability to pay future dividends or
sell assets and may result in our debt becoming immediately due and payable. 
Should our internally generated funds from operations be insufficient to fund 
the capital expenditures required to maintain
operations, we may draw additional funds from our current credit facilities or 
we may consider seeking additional capital in the form of debt or equity. There 
is also no certainty that any of the
additional sources of capital would be available when&nbsp;required. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>At
June&nbsp;30, 2016, net debt was $1,942.5&nbsp;million, as compared to 
$2,049.9&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2015, representing a decrease of 
$107.4&nbsp;million. This decrease is
mainly due to the strengthening of the Canadian dollar against the 
U.S.&nbsp;dollar which reduced the carrying value of our U.S.&nbsp;dollar 
denominated long-term notes and bank loans at
June&nbsp;30, 2016. Funds from operations exceeded capital spending by 
$9.7&nbsp;million for YTD 2016 further reducing net&nbsp;debt. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Bank Loan  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>On March&nbsp;31, 2016, we amended 
our credit facilities to provide us with increased financial flexibility. The 
amendments included reducing our credit facilities to
US$575&nbsp;million, granting our banking syndicate first priority security over
our assets and restructuring our financial covenants. The amended revolving 
extendible secured credit facilities are
comprised of a US$25&nbsp;million operating loan and a US$350&nbsp;million 
syndicated loan and a US$200&nbsp;million syndicated loan for our wholly-owned 
subsidiary, Baytex Energy
USA,&nbsp;Inc. (collectively, the "Revolving Facilities"). </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
Revolving Facilities are not borrowing base facilities and do not require annual
or semi-annual reviews. The facilities contain standard commercial covenants as 
detailed below and do not require
any mandatory principal payments prior to maturity on June&nbsp;4, 2019. Baytex 
may request an extension under the Revolving Facilities which could extend the 
revolving period for up to four years
(subject to a maximum four-year term at any time). The agreement relating to the
Revolving Facilities is accessible on the SEDAR website at www.sedar.com (filed 
under the category "Material
contracts&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Credit agreements" on April&nbsp;13,&nbsp;2016). 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
weighted average interest rates on the credit facilities for the three and six 
months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 were 3.5%, as compared to 4.0% and 3.1%, 
respectively, for the same periods
in&nbsp;2015. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>26</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Baytex Energy
Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter Report</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"> 2016</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Covenants  </B></FONT></P>

applicable to the Revolving Facilities. The following table
summarizes the financial covenants contained in the amended credit agreement and
our compliance therewith as at June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2016. </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>"Senior Secured 
Debt" is defined as the principal amount of the bank loan and other secured 
obligations identified in the credit agreement. As at
June&nbsp;30, 2016, our Senior Secured Debt totaled 
$359&nbsp;million.</I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-
9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(2)</I></FONT></DT><DD 
style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Bank
EBITDA is calculated based on terms and definitions set out in the credit 
agreement which adjusts
net income (loss) for financing and interest expenses,
income tax, certain specific unrealized and non-cash transactions (including 
depletion, depreciation, exploration expenses, unrealized gains and losses on 
financial derivatives and foreign exchange
and stock based compensation) and is calculated based on a trailing twelve month
basis. Bank EBITDA for the twelve months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 was 
$417&nbsp;million.</I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-
9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(3)</I></FONT></DT><DD 
style="font-family:arial;"><FONT
 style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Interest coverage is computed as the 
ratio of Bank EBITDA to financing and interest expenses, excluding non-cash 
interest and accretion on asset retirement
obligations, and is calculated on a trailing twelve month basis. Financing and 
interest expenses for the twelve months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 were 
$103&nbsp;million.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>If we exceed or breach any of the 
covenants under the Revolving Facilities or our long-term notes, we may be 
required to repay, refinance or renegotiate the
loan terms and may be restricted from paying dividends to our shareholders or 
taking on further&nbsp;debt. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Long-Term Notes  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Baytex has five series of long-term 
notes outstanding that total $1.54&nbsp;billion as at June&nbsp;30, 2016. The 
long-term notes do not contain any significant financial
maintenance covenants. The long-term notes contain a debt incurrence covenant
that restricts our ability to raise additional debt beyond our existing credit 
facilities and long-term notes unless we
maintain a minimum fixed charge coverage ratio (computed as the ratio of EBITDA 
to financing and interest expenses on a trailing twelve month basis) of 2.5:1. 
As at June&nbsp;30, 2016, the fixed
charge coverage ratio was&nbsp;4.05:1. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>On
February&nbsp;17, 2011, we issued US$150&nbsp;million principal amount of senior
unsecured notes bearing interest at 6.75% payable semi-annually with principal 
repayable on February&nbsp;17,
2021. These notes as of February&nbsp;17, 2016 are redeemable at our option, in 
whole or in part, at specified redemption prices. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>On
July&nbsp;19, 2012, we issued $300&nbsp;million principal amount of senior 
unsecured notes bearing interest at 6.625% payable semi-annually with principal 
repayable on July&nbsp;19, 2022.
These notes are redeemable at our option, in whole or in part, commencing on 
July&nbsp;19, 2017 at specified redemption prices. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>On
June&nbsp;6, 2014, we issued US$800&nbsp;million of senior unsecured notes, 
comprised of US$400&nbsp;million of 5.125% notes due June&nbsp;1, 2021 
(the&nbsp;"2021 Notes") and
US$400&nbsp;million of 5.625% notes due June&nbsp;1, 2024 (the&nbsp;"2024 
Notes"). The 2021 Notes and the 2024 Notes pay interest semi-annually and are 
redeemable at our option, in whole or in
part, commencing on June&nbsp;1, 2017 (in&nbsp;the case of the 2021 Notes) and 
June&nbsp;1, 2019 (in&nbsp;the case of the 2024 Notes) at specified redemption 
prices. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Pursuant
to the acquisition of Aurora Oil&nbsp;&amp; Gas Limited ("Aurora"), on 
June&nbsp;11, 2014, we assumed all of Aurora's existing senior unsecured notes 
and then purchased and cancelled
approximately 98% of the outstanding notes. On February&nbsp;27, 2015, we 
redeemed one tranche of the remaining Aurora notes at a price of 
US$8.3&nbsp;million plus </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">Baytex Energy Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter 
Report</FONT> <FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">2016</FONT><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
SIZE=2>27</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=27,EFW="2229414",CP="BAYTEX ENERGY 
CORP.",DN="2",CHK=308718,FOLIO='27',FILE='DISK130:
[16ZBV1.16ZBV13101]DI13101A.;24',USER='JKEENE',CD=';9-AUG-2016;12:54' -->
<A NAME="page_di13101_1_28"> </A>
<BR>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>accrued
interest. The remaining Aurora notes (US$6.4&nbsp;million principal amount) are 
redeemable at our option, in whole or in part, as of April&nbsp;1, 2016 at 
specified redemption prices. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Financial Instruments  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>As part of our normal operations, we 
are exposed to a number of financial risks, including liquidity risk, credit 
risk and market risk. Liquidity risk is the risk that the
Company will encounter difficulty in meeting obligations associated with 
financial liabilities. We manage liquidity risk through cash and debt 
management. Credit risk is the risk that a counterparty
to a financial asset will default, resulting in the Company incurring a loss. 
Credit risk is managed by entering into sales contracts with creditworthy 
entities and reviewing our exposure to
individual entities on a regular basis. Market risk is the risk that the fair 
value of future cash flows will fluctuate due to movements in market prices, and
is comprised of foreign currency risk,
interest rate risk and commodity price risk. Market risk is partially mitigated 
through a series of derivative contracts intended to reduce some of the 
volatility of our funds from operations. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>A
summary of the risk management contracts in place as at June&nbsp;30, 2016 and 
the accounting treatment thereof is disclosed in note&nbsp;15 to&nbsp;the 
consolidated financial statements. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Shareholders' Capital  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>We are authorized to issue an 
unlimited number of common shares and 10,000,000&nbsp;preferred shares. The 
rights and terms of preferred shares are determined upon issuance.
As at July&nbsp;27, 2016, we had 211,541,490&nbsp;common shares and no preferred
shares issued and outstanding. During the three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30, 2016, we issued 25,916 and
131,798&nbsp;common shares, respectively, pursuant to our share-based 
compensation program. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Contractual Obligations  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>We have a number of financial 
obligations that are incurred in the ordinary course of business. These 
obligations are of a recurring nature and impact the Company's funds from
operations in an ongoing manner. A significant portion of these obligations will
be funded by funds from operations. These obligations as of June&nbsp;30, 2016 
and the expected timing for funding
these obligations are noted in the table&nbsp;below. </FONT></P>

size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>The bank loan is
covenant-based with a revolving period that is extendible annually for up to a 
four-year term. Unless extended, the revolving period will end
on June&nbsp;4, 2019, with all amounts to be repaid on 
such&nbsp;date.</I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-
9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(2)</I></FONT></DT><DD 
style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>Principal amount of instruments.  </I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>We also have ongoing obligations 
related to the abandonment and reclamation of well sites and facilities which 
have reached the end of their economic lives.
Programs to abandon and reclaim well sites and facilities are undertaken 
regularly in accordance with applicable legislative requirements. </FONT></P>

<A NAME="page_di13101_1_29"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>OFF BALANCE SHEET TRANSACTIONS  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>We do not have any financial 
arrangements that are excluded from the consolidated financial statements as at
June&nbsp;30, 2016, nor are any such arrangements outstanding as
of the date of this&nbsp;MD&amp;A. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>CRITICAL ACCOUNTING ESTIMATES  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>There have been no changes in our 
critical accounting estimates in the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016. 
Further information on our critical accounting policies and
estimates can be found in the notes to the annual consolidated financial 
statements and MD&amp;A for the year ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>CHANGES IN ACCOUNTING STANDARDS  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>We did not adopt any new accounting 
standards for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016. A description of 
accounting standards that will be effective in the future is
included in the notes to the audited consolidated financial statements and 
MD&amp;A for the year ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>INTERNAL CONTROL OVER FINANCIAL 
REPORTING  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>We are required to comply with 
Multilateral Instrument&nbsp;52-109 "Certification of Disclosure in Issuers' 
Annual and Interim Filings". This instrument requires us to
disclose in our interim MD&amp;A any weaknesses in or changes to our internal 
control over financial reporting during the period that may have materially 
affected, or are reasonably likely to materially
affect, our internal controls over financial reporting. We confirm that no such 
weaknesses were identified in, or changes were made to, internal controls over 
financial reporting during the three and
six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2016. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>QUARTERLY FINANCIAL INFORMATION  
</B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I>In the interest of providing our 
shareholders and potential investors with information regarding Baytex, 
including management's assessment of the
Company's future plans and operations, certain statements in this document are 
"forward-looking statements" within the meaning of the United&nbsp;States 
Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of
1995 and "forward-looking information" within the meaning of applicable Canadian
securities legislation (collectively, "forward-looking statements"). In some 
cases, forward-looking statements can be
identified by terminology such as "anticipate", "believe", "continue", "could", 
"estimate", "expect", "forecast", "intend", "may", "objective", "ongoing", 
"outlook", "potential", "project", "plan",
"should", "target", "would", "will" or similar words suggesting future outcomes,
events or performance. The forward-looking statements contained in this document
speak only as of the date of this
document and are expressly qualified by this cautionary 
statement.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I>Specifically, this document 
contains forward-looking statements relating to but not limited to: our business
strategies, plans and objectives; crude oil and natural gas prices
and the price differentials between light, medium and heavy oil prices; our 
expectation for Canadian operating expenses for the remainder of 2016; our 
ability to reduce the volatility in our funds
from operations by utilizing financial derivative contracts; the reassessment of
our tax filings by the Canada Revenue Agency; our intention to defend the 
reassessments; our view of our tax filing  </I></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">Baytex Energy Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter 
Report</FONT> <FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">2016</FONT><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
SIZE=2>29</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

CORP.",DN="2",CHK=937474,FOLIO='29',FILE='DISK130:

<A NAME="page_di13101_1_30"> </A>
<BR>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I> position; the length of time it 
would take to resolve the reassessments; that we would owe cash taxes and late 
payment interest if the reassessment is successful; the cost to drill, complete 
and equip
a well in the Eagle Ford; the sufficiency of our capital resources to meet our 
on-going short, medium and long-term commitments; the financial capacity of 
counterparties to honor outstanding
obligations to us in the normal course of business; our belief that the amended 
credit facilities provide increased financial flexibility; and the existence, 
operation and strategy of our risk
management program. In addition, information and statements relating to reserves
are deemed to be forward-looking statements, as they involve implied assessment,
based on certain estimates and
assumptions, that the reserves described exist in quantities predicted or 
estimated, and that the reserves can be profitably produced in 
the&nbsp;future.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I>These forward-looking statements 
are based on certain key assumptions regarding, among other things: petroleum 
and natural gas prices and differentials between light, medium
and heavy oil prices; well production rates and reserve volumes; our ability to 
add production and reserves through our exploration and development activities; 
capital expenditure levels; our ability
to borrow under our credit agreements; the receipt, in a timely manner, of 
regulatory and other required approvals for our operating activities; the 
availability and cost of labour and other industry
services; interest and foreign exchange rates; the continuance of existing and, 
in certain circumstances, proposed tax and royalty regimes; our ability to 
develop our crude oil and natural gas
properties
in the manner currently contemplated; and current industry conditions, laws and 
regulations continuing in effect (or, where changes are proposed, such changes 
being adopted as anticipated). Readers
are cautioned that such assumptions, although considered reasonable by Baytex at
the time of preparation, may prove to be&nbsp;incorrect.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I>Actual results achieved will vary 
from the information provided herein as a result of numerous known and unknown 
risks and uncertainties and other factors. Such factors
include, but are not limited to: the volatility of oil and natural gas prices; 
further declines or an extended period of the currently low oil and natural gas 
prices; failure to comply with the
covenants in our debt agreements; that our credit facilities may not provide 
sufficient liquidity or may not be renewed; uncertainties in the capital markets
that may restrict or increase our cost of
capital or borrowing; risks associated with a third-party operating our Eagle 
Ford properties; changes in government regulations that affect the oil and gas 
industry; changes in environmental, health
and safety regulations; restrictions or costs imposed by climate change 
initiatives; variations in interest rates and foreign exchange rates; risks 
associated with our hedging activities; the cost of
developing and operating our assets; risks related to the accessibility, 
availability, proximity and capacity of gathering, processing and pipeline 
systems; depletion of our reserves; risks associated
with the exploitation of our properties and our ability to acquire reserves; 
changes in income tax or other laws or government incentive programs; 
uncertainties associated with estimating petroleum
and natural gas reserves; our inability to fully insure against all risks; risks
of counterparty default; risks associated with acquiring, developing and 
exploring for oil and natural gas and other
aspects of our operations; risks associated with large projects; risks related 
to our thermal heavy oil projects; risks associated with the ownership of our 
securities, including changes in
market-based factors and the discretionary nature of dividend payments; risks 
for United&nbsp;States and other non-resident shareholders, including the 
ability to enforce civil remedies, differing
practices for reporting reserves and production, additional taxation applicable 
to non-residents and foreign exchange risk; and other factors, many of which are
beyond our control. These and
additional risk factors are discussed in our Annual Information Form, Annual 
Report on Form&nbsp;40-F and&nbsp;Management's Discussion and Analysis for the 
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, as
filed with Canadian securities regulatory authorities and the 
U.S.&nbsp;Securities and Exchange Commission.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I>The above summary of assumptions 
and risks related to forward-looking statements has been provided in order to 
provide shareholders and potential investors with a more complete
perspective on Baytex's current and future operations and such information may 
not be appropriate for other&nbsp;purposes.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I>There is no representation by 
Baytex that actual results achieved will be the same in whole or in part as 
those referenced in the forward-looking statements and Baytex does not
undertake any obligation to update publicly or to revise any of the included 
forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future 
events or otherwise, except as may be required
by applicable securities&nbsp;law.</I></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_fe13101_1_35"> </A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"Black" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"font-family:arial;" -->
</FONT> <FONT SIZE=3><B>NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED<BR>
INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>  </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>For the three and six 
months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015<BR></FONT> <FONT 
SIZE=2><I>(all&nbsp;tabular amounts in thousands of Canadian dollars, except per
common share amounts)
(unaudited)</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;REPORTING ENTITY  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Baytex Energy Corp. 
(the&nbsp;"Company" or "Baytex") is an oil and gas corporation engaged in the 
acquisition, development and production of oil and natural gas in the
Western Canadian Sedimentary Basin and the United&nbsp;States. The Company's 
common shares are traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange and the New&nbsp;York 
Stock Exchange under the symbol BTE. The
Company's head and principal office is located at 2800,
520&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;3rd&nbsp;Avenue S.W., Calgary, Alberta, T2P&nbsp;0R3, and 
its registered office is located at
2400, 525&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;8th&nbsp;Avenue S.W., Calgary, Alberta, T2P&nbsp;1G1.
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I>The audited consolidated financial
statements of the Company as at and for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 
are available through our filings on SEDAR at www.sedar.com
and through the U.S.&nbsp;Securities and Exchange Commission 
at&nbsp;www.sec.gov.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;BASIS OF
PRESENTATION  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The condensed interim unaudited 
consolidated financial statements ("consolidated financial statements") have 
been prepared in accordance with International Accounting Standard
34, Interim Financial Reporting, as issued by the International Accounting 
Standards Board. These consolidated financial statements should be read in 
conjunction with the annual audited consolidated
financial statements as of December&nbsp;31, 2015. The
Company's accounting policies are unchanged compared to December&nbsp;31, 2015. 
The use of estimates and judgments is also consistent with the December&nbsp;31,
2015 financial statements. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
consolidated financial statements were approved by the Board of Directors of 
Baytex on July&nbsp;27,&nbsp;2016. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
consolidated financial statements have been prepared on a historical cost basis,
except for derivative financial instruments which have been measured at fair 
value. The consolidated financial
statements are presented in Canadian dollars, which is the Company's functional 
currency. All financial information is rounded to the nearest thousand, except 
per share amounts and when otherwise
indicated. Prior period financial statement amounts have been reclassified to 
conform with current period presentation. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">Baytex Energy Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter 
Report</FONT> <FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">2016</FONT><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
SIZE=2>35</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=35,EFW="2229414",CP="BAYTEX ENERGY 
CORP.",DN="2",CHK=872963,FOLIO='35',FILE='DISK130:

<A NAME="page_fe13101_1_36"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SEGMENTED FINANCIAL INFORMATION  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Baytex's reportable segments are 
determined based on the Company's geographic locations. </FONT></P>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT 
SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Canada
includes the exploration for, and the development and production of, crude oil 
and natural gas in Western&nbsp;Canada.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT 
SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>U.S.&nbsp;includes
the exploration for, and the development and production of, crude oil and 
natural gas in the&nbsp;USA.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT 
SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Corporate
includes corporate activities and items not allocated between operating 
segments. </FONT></DD></DL>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>On March&nbsp;31, 2016, Baytex 
amended the credit facilities with its banking syndicate to grant the banking 
syndicate first priority security over its
assets. The amended revolving extendible secured credit facilities are comprised
of a US$25&nbsp;million operating loan and a US$350&nbsp;million syndicated loan
for Baytex and a
US$200&nbsp;million syndicated loan for Baytex's wholly-owned subsidiary, Baytex
Energy USA,&nbsp;Inc. (collectively, the "Revolving Facilities"). </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>38</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Baytex Energy
Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter Report</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"> 2016</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=38,EFW="2229414",CP="BAYTEX ENERGY 
CORP.",DN="2",CHK=335591,FOLIO='38',FILE='DISK130:
[16ZBV1.16ZBV13101]FE13101A.;20',USER='JKEENE',CD=';9-AUG-2016;13:11' -->
<A NAME="page_fe13101_1_39"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
Revolving Facilities are not borrowing base facilities and do not require annual
or semi-annual reviews. The facilities contain standard commercial covenants and
do not require any mandatory
principal payments prior to maturity on June&nbsp;4, 2019. Baytex may request an
extension under the Revolving Facilities which could extend the revolving period
for up to four years (subject to a
maximum four-year period at any time). Advances (including letters of credit) 
under the Revolving Facilities can be drawn in either Canadian or 
U.S.&nbsp;funds and bear interest at the bank's prime
lending rate, bankers' acceptance discount rates or London Interbank Offered 
Rates, plus applicable margins. In the event that Baytex exceeds any of the 
covenants under the Revolving Facilities,
Baytex may be required to repay, refinance or renegotiate the loan terms and may
be restricted from paying dividends to shareholders or taking on 
further&nbsp;debt. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>At
June&nbsp;30, 2016, Baytex was in compliance with all of the covenants contained
in the Revolving Facilities. The following table summarizes the financial 
covenants contained in the Revolving
Facilities and our compliance therewith as at June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2016. 
</FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>"Senior Secured 
Debt" is defined as the principal amount of the bank loan and other secured 
obligations identified in the credit agreement. As at
June&nbsp;30, 2016, our Senior Secured Debt totaled 
$359&nbsp;million.</I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-
9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(2)</I></FONT></DT><DD 
style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Bank
EBITDA is calculated based on terms and definitions set out in the credit 
agreement which adjusts
net income (loss) for financing and interest expenses,
income tax, certain specific unrealized and non-cash transactions (including 
depletion, depreciation, exploration expenses, unrealized gains and losses on 
financial derivatives and foreign exchange
and stock based compensation) and is calculated based on a trailing twelve month
basis. Bank EBITDA for the twelve months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 was 
$417&nbsp;million.</I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-
9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(3)</I></FONT></DT><DD 
style="font-family:arial;"><FONT
 style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Interest coverage is computed as the 
ratio of Bank EBITDA to financing and interest expenses excluding non-cash 
interest and accretion on asset retirement
obligations, and is calculated on a trailing twelve month basis. Financing and 
interest expenses for the twelve months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 were 
$103&nbsp;million.</I></FONT></DD></DL>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Changes in the 
estimated costs, the timing of abandonment and reclamation and the status of 
wells are factors resulting in a change
in&nbsp;estimate.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SHAREHOLDERS' CAPITAL  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The authorized capital of Baytex 
consists of an unlimited number of common shares without nominal or par value 
and 10,000,000&nbsp;preferred shares without nominal or par
value, issuable in series. Baytex establishes the rights and terms of the 
preferred shares upon issuance. As at June&nbsp;30, 2016, no preferred shares 
have been issued by the Company and all common
shares issued were fully&nbsp;paid. </FONT></P>

SIZE=2><B>4,299,969</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>10.&nbsp;&nbsp;SHARE AWARD 
INCENTIVE PLAN  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The Company has a full-value award 
plan (the&nbsp;"Share Award Incentive Plan") pursuant to which restricted awards
and performance awards (collectively, "share awards") may
be granted to the directors, officers and employees of the Company and its 
subsidiaries. The maximum number of common shares issuable under the Share Award
Incentive Plan (and&nbsp;any other
long-term incentive plans of the Company) shall not at any time exceed 3.8% of 
the then-issued and outstanding common&nbsp;shares. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Each
restricted award entitles the holder to be issued the number of common shares 
designated in the restricted award (plus dividend equivalents). Each performance
award entitles the holder to be
issued the number of common shares designated in the performance award (plus 
dividend equivalents) multiplied by a payout multiplier. Both awards are 
expensed over the vesting&nbsp;period. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company recorded compensation expense related to the share awards of 
$3.9&nbsp;million for the three months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 
($8.2&nbsp;million for the three months ended
June&nbsp;30, 2015) and $8.4&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30,
2016 ($16.2&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015). 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>40</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Baytex Energy
Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter Report</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"> 2016</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=40,EFW="2229414",CP="BAYTEX ENERGY 
CORP.",DN="2",CHK=959982,FOLIO='40',FILE='DISK130:
[16ZBV1.16ZBV13101]FE13101A.;20',USER='JKEENE',CD=';9-AUG-2016;13:11' -->
<A NAME="page_fe13101_1_41"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
weighted average fair value of share awards granted during the six months ended 
June&nbsp;30, 2016 was $2.75 per restricted and performance award (for&nbsp;the 
six months ended June&nbsp;30,
2015, $17.11 per restricted and performance award). </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
number of share awards outstanding is detailed below: </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>For the three months ended 
June&nbsp;30, 2016, 3.8&nbsp;million share awards were anti-dilutive 
(June&nbsp;30,
2015&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;3.9&nbsp;million share awards). For the six months ended 
June&nbsp;30, 2016, 3.8&nbsp;million share awards were anti-dilutive 
(June&nbsp;30,
2015&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;1.1&nbsp;million share&nbsp;awards). </FONT></P>

<TD WIDTH="11%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>22,620</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=0>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="64%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Other</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>(953</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

SIZE=2>23</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TR VALIGN="TOP">

<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=2 style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Income tax 
(recovery)</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>$</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>(98,631</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>$</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>(37,613</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>)</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=8 style="font-family:arial;"><HR NOSHADE SIZE=4></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Expected income 
tax rate increased due to an increase in the corporate income tax rate in 
Alberta (from 10% to 12%), offset by a decrease in the Texas franchise
tax rate (from 1.00% to&nbsp;0.75%).</I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-
family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">(2)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>A deferred income tax asset has not been 
recognized for allowable capital losses of $109&nbsp;million related to the 
unrealized foreign exchange
losses
arising from the translation of U.S.&nbsp;dollar denominated long-term notes 
($149&nbsp;million as at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015).</I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>In June&nbsp;2016, certain indirect 
subsidiary entities received reassessments from the Canada Revenue Agency 
(the&nbsp;"CRA") that deny non-capital loss
deductions relevant to the calculation of income taxes for the years 2011 
through 2015. These reassessments follow the previously disclosed letter from 
the CRA received by Baytex in
November&nbsp;2014 proposing to issue such reassessments. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Baytex
remains confident that the tax filings of the affected entities are correct and 
will file&nbsp;a notice of objection for each notice of reassessment received. 
These notices of objection will
be reviewed by the Appeals Division of CRA; a process that Baytex estimates 
could take up to two years. If the Appeals Division upholds the notices of 
reassessment Baytex has the right to appeal to
the Tax Court of Canada; a process that Baytex estimates could take a further 
two years. Should Baytex be unsuccessful at the Tax Court of Canada, additional 
appeals are available; a process that
Baytex estimates could take another two years and potentially longer. The 
reassessments do not require Baytex to pay any amounts in order to participate 
in the appeals process. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>By
way of background, Baytex acquired all of the interests in several privately 
held commercial trusts in 2010 with accumulated non-capital losses of 
$591&nbsp;million (the&nbsp;"Losses"). The
Losses were subsequently used to reduce the taxable income of those trusts. The 
reassessments disallow the deduction of the Losses under the general anti-
avoidance rule of the Income Tax&nbsp;Act
(Canada). If, after exhausting available appeals, the deduction of Losses 
continues to be disallowed, Baytex would owe cash taxes for the years 2012 
through 2015 and an additional amount for late
payment interest. The amount of cash taxes owing and the late payment interest 
are dependent upon the amount of unused tax shelter available to offset the 
reassessed income, including tax shelter from
future years available for "carry back" to the years 2012 through&nbsp;2015. 
</FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>15.&nbsp;&nbsp;FINANCIAL 
INSTRUMENTS AND RISK MANAGEMENT  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The carrying amounts of the Company's
U.S.&nbsp;dollar denominated monetary assets and liabilities at the reporting 
date are as&nbsp;follows: </FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Based on the 
weighted average price/unit for the remainder of the contract.  
</I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>(2)</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I> Producer 3-way 
option consists of a
sold call, a bought put and a sold put. To illustrate, in a $60/$50/$40 
contract, Baytex receives WTI&nbsp;+&nbsp;US$10/bbl when WTI is at or
below US$40/bbl; Baytex receives US$50/bbl when WTI is between US$40/bbl and 
US$50/bbl; Baytex receives WTI when WTI is between US$50/bbl and US$60/bbl; and 
Baytex receives US$60/bbl when WTI is above
US$60/bbl.</I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-
9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">(3)</FONT></DT><DD 
style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><I>Counterparty has the option to enter into a fixed sell for the 
periods, volumes and prices&nbsp;noted.</I></FONT></DD><DT style='font-
family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">(4)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT
 style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>The Company restructured the sold 
call options subsequent to June&nbsp;30, 2016. At June&nbsp;30, 2016 the price 
was US$49.57/bbl.</I></FONT></DD></DL>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>As at June&nbsp;30, 2016, Baytex had 
committed at fixed price to deliver the volumes of raw bitumen as noted below to
market on&nbsp;rail: </FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>

<TD WIDTH="29%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">Period </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="17%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="19%" ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">Term volume</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=5 style="font-family:arial;"><HR NOSHADE SIZE=4></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Raw bitumen</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="17%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="29%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>July&nbsp;2016 to 
December&nbsp;2016</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="17%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="19%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>7,400&nbsp;bbl/d</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Raw bitumen</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="17%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="29%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>January&nbsp;2017 to 
December&nbsp;2017</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="17%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="19%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2>5,000&nbsp;bbl/d</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=5 style="font-family:arial;"><HR NOSHADE SIZE=4></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>16.&nbsp;&nbsp;SUBSEQUENT EVENT  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>On July&nbsp;27, 2016, Baytex 
disposed of its operated interest in certain Eagle Ford properties, which 
consisted of oil and gas properties and exploration and evaluations
assets, for approximately $55&nbsp;million. At June&nbsp;30, 2016,
$2.3&nbsp;million of exploration and evaluation assets and $11.7&nbsp;million of
oil and gas properties relating to the disposition were reclassified to assets 
held for&nbsp;sale. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>44</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Baytex Energy
Corp.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Second Quarter Report</FONT><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"> 2016</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>*</I></FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;"><I>Oil equivalent 
amounts may be misleading, particularly if used in isolation. In accordance with
NI&nbsp;51-101, a boe conversion ratio for natural gas of
6&nbsp;Mcf: 1&nbsp;bbl has been used, which is based on an energy equivalency 
conversion method primarily applicable at the burner tip and does not represent 
a value equivalency at
the&nbsp;wellhead.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
